_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Worth Chemical Corporation
Chattanooga, TN


Worth Chemical Corporation is a chemical distribution plant located in Chattanooga, TN. It is part of HCI USA Distribution Companies Inc. headquartered in St. Louis, Missouri.  HCI USA Distribution Companies is a distribution company serving customers worldwide with products, chemicals and advanced materials. The company ranks among the top 10 chemical distribution firms in North America.  HCI USA Distribution Companies has approximately 1,000 employees at more than 50 facilities in 21 states and Mexico.  HCI USA Distribution Companies may be found at its Web Page: www.hollandchemical.com.

It is the world-wide policy of HCI USA Distribution Companies to design, blend and distribute its products and to handle materials throughout their life cycle in a manner that protects the environment and safeguards employees, customers and the public from unacceptable risk. 

This facility participates in the Responsible Distribution Process program of the National Association of Chemical Distributors. The Community Outreach and Emergency Response Plan of Responsible Distribution Process brings chemical distribution plants and local communities together through communications and cooperative emergency planning. We have also been members of the Chlorine Institute for 15 years. 

The HCI Safety Program of the HCI Health, Safety and Environmental Program is designed to prevent fires, explosions and accidental chemical releases. The program requires safety audits, inspection and maintenance programs, and safety training for employees and contract workers. Facilities are encouraged to listen to the concerns of the community and to consider these concerns when designing and implementing process safety systems.

In this distribution facility, we handle chlorine, which is considered hazardous by the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA).  The same properties that make this chemical valuable as a commodity also makes it necessary to observe c

ertain safety precautions in handling it to reduce the threat to nearby members of our community as well as to that of the people in our company. It is our policy to adhere to all applicable Federal, State and Local regulations. 

We are located at 607 Hudson Road in Chattanooga.   We employ 13 people.  The chlorine that is distributed from this plant is used by water treatment facilities and general industry to purify drinking water and sanitize swimming pools. We are active participants in the Hamilton County Local Emergency Planning Committee.
 
The Emergency Programs in place at this facility include an:

EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN 
FIRE PREVENTION PLAN
EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN
TRANSPORTATION EMERGENCIES PLAN
SPILL PREVENTION CONTROL & COUNTERMEASURE PLAN
 
 The EPA was mandated by law to define the Worst Case Scenario (WCS) as an unlikely event: the largest single storage vessel losing all of its contents in 10 minutes. This facility does have off-site consequences to the public and the environment.
 
 The EPA calls a more likely incident, many of which will have limited or no off-site consequences, an Alternate Release Scenario (ARS). An ARS could be a hose or small vessel leak. For this facility, the ARS will have off-site consequences.
 
 HCI USA Distribution Co., Inc maintains Health, Safety and Environmental manuals, which contain company policies for Risk Management, Training, Product Stewardship, Community Outreach and Hazard Communication among others.  The manuals also include Emergency Action Plans, Emergency Response Plans, and Transportation Emergency Plans. The facility is also in compliance with the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard which requires careful reviews of the hazards with and the safeguards that must be implemented to prevent releases of regulated chemicals. This facility has 30 years experience handling chlorine. Our repackaging operations have automatic shutdown systems. 
 
There h

ave been no accidental releases in the past 5 years.  No one off-site was injured and no evacuation measures have ever been taken.
 
This facility has emergency plans, which have been coordinated with the Chattanooga Fire Department/Hazmat Team and the Hamilton County Local Emergency Response Committee (LEPC). The facility conducted a joint training and drill on chlorine with the Chattanooga Fire Department/Hazmat Team and Hamilton County Emergency Services on October 29, 1998.  All of our safety equipment is Y2K compatible.

Our response plan for chlorine is based upon the Chlorine Institute's Pamphlet 64, Emergency Response Plans for Chlorine Facilities. The emergency response plans for this facility include procedures for notification of the local fire authority and notification of any potentially affected neighbors.
 
To continue to improve upon its safety record, this facility does conduct incident investigations, safety compliance audits, continuous training of emergency procedures, and continuous community outreach actions which include: educating and training neighbors, customers, fire departments and emergency response teams.
